title: Excel Template
text: article provides comprehensive documentation Excel template structure used ospsuite.qualificationplaneditor package. Understanding structure essential effectively editing qualification plans Excel format. Excel template consists multiple worksheets, serving specific purpose defining qualification plan. sheets automatically populated edited (informational sheets), others designed user input (editable sheets).

title: Excel Template
text: Excel template uses background colors convey important information status purpose data. Understanding conventions help quickly identify needs attention.

title: Excel Template
text: Sheet tab header colors indicate data availability status: Light Blue: Data successfully found corresponding Excel sheet populated project snapshots, observed datasets, /qualification plan information. sheets contain actionable data. Yellow: data found populate corresponding sheet. typically means qualification plan doesn’t contain type information yet, matching data provided conversion process.

title: Excel Template
text: Background colors data rows indicate status projects, observed datasets, items relative existing qualification plan: Green: project observed dataset new - exist current qualification plan assumed added qualification. Review items carefully represent new content. Grey: project observed dataset already exists current qualification plan, either: present list newly provided snapshots/observed datasets, present version/path identical ’s qualification plan items unchanged typically don’t require action. Light Yellow: project observed dataset exists current qualification plan newly provided snapshots/observed datasets, version path changed. items represent updates reviewed ensure changes intentional.

title: Excel Template
text: Use color codes prioritize review: 1. Green items: Verify new additions correct intended 2. Yellow items: Check updates reflect desired changes 3. Grey items: Generally action needed unless want modify usage plan

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Defines version Qualification Plan Schema used qualification plan. Format: value formatted X.Y (e.g., 2.3, 3.0). edit: can check available version tags QualificationPlan GitHub repository.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Lists project identifiers (Id) file paths URLs. Content: - Id: Unique identifier project (typically project name) - Path: File path GitHub URL project snapshot JSON file Background: Uses row status color convention (green/yellow/grey) described . Editing: EDIT sheet. automatically populated project snapshots qualification plan. Modifications may cause data inconsistencies.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Lists simulations outputs project. information extracted project snapshot files. Content: - Project: Project identifier - Simulation: Simulation name within project - Output: Output variable/observable simulation Background: Uses row status color convention. Editing: EDIT sheet. simulation output information must match exists actual project files.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Lists simulations associated observed data project. Content: - Project: Project identifier - Simulation: Simulation name - ObservedData: Observed dataset identifier linked simulation Background: Uses row status color convention. Editing: EDIT sheet. information extracted project files defines observed data compared simulation.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Lists observed datasets identifiers, file paths, data types. Content: - Id: Unique identifier observed dataset - Path: File path URL observed data CSV file - Type: Type observed data (e.g., TimeProfile, DDIRatio, PKRatio) Background: Uses row status color convention. Editing: CAN edit Type column change observed data interpreted. Common types include: - TimeProfile: Time-course concentration data - DDIRatio: Drug-drug interaction ratio data - PKRatio: Pharmacokinetic parameter ratio data edit Id Path columns must match actual data files.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Defines Building Block inheritance relationships projects. Content: - Project: Project identifier - BB-Type: Type building block (e.g., Compound, Individual, Formulation) - BB-Name: Name building block - Parent-Project: Source project inherit building block edit: Fill Parent-Project column specify project inherit building block another project instead defining locally. Data validation: Excel dropdown list provided select available projects, ensuring reference valid parent projects. Use case: useful multiple projects share common building blocks (e.g., compound definition), allowing avoid duplication maintain consistency.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Defines inheritance simulated parameters projects simulations. Content: - Project: Target project parameter inheritance defined - Parent Project: Source project parameters inherited - Parent Simulation: Source simulation within parent project - Path: Parameter path inherit - TargetSimulation: (Optional) alternative target simulation name within target project edit: Fill columns specify parameter inheritance. example, Simulation B use parameter values Simulation different project, specify source project simulation Parent Project Parent Simulation, target project (optionally TargetSimulation) accordingly. Data validation: Excel dropdowns provided selecting available projects simulations. Use case: Parameter inheritance useful ensuring consistency similar simulations across projects use parameter values.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Lists individual plot evaluations project simulation. plots generated directly simulation outputs. Content: - Project simulation information - Plot configuration details - Section Reference: qualification report section plot appear edit: Fill Section Reference column include evaluation corresponding section qualification report. Leave empty exclude plot. Data validation: Dropdowns provided select available sections (defined Sections sheet). Use case: Control simulation outputs appear qualification report organize appropriate sections.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Define configure Comparison Time Profile (CT) plots. CT_Plots: Defines properties CT plot (title, axes, scaling, etc.) CT_Mapping: Maps specific simulation outputs observed data CT plot edit: 1. Define CT plots CT_Plots sheet unique identifiers 2. Use CT_Mapping specify outputs observed data appear plot 3. Assign plots report sections using Section Reference column Data validation: Dropdowns help select available sections, projects, simulations, observed data, etc. Use case: CT plots allow compare simulation outputs observed data time, useful model validation.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Define configure Goodness Fit (GOF) plots. GOF_Plots: Defines GOF plot properties GOF_Mapping: Maps data GOF plots edit: Similar CT plots - define plots GOF_Plots map data GOF_Mapping. Use case: GOF plots provide statistical visualizations well simulations match observed data across multiple scenarios.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Define configure DDI Ratio plots drug-drug interaction studies. DDIRatio_Plots: Defines DDI ratio plot properties DDIRatio_Mapping: Maps DDI ratio data plots edit: Define plots map DDI ratio observed data . Use case: Specialized plots visualizing perpetrator-victim drug-drug interactions ratios.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Define configure PK Ratio plots pharmacokinetic parameter ratios. PKRatio_Plots: Defines PK ratio plot properties PKRatio_Mapping: Maps PK ratio data plots Use case: Compare predicted vs. observed pharmacokinetic parameters using ratio analysis.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Define structure organization qualification report. Content: - Section Reference: Unique tag/identifier section - Section Title: Display title section - Parent Section: (Optional) Parent section creating subsections - Section Description: (Optional) Description introduction section edit: 1. Create top-level sections filling Section Reference Title, leaving Parent Section empty 2. Create subsections filling Parent Section existing section reference 3. Use section references plot evaluation sheets assign content sections Data validation: Parent Section dropdown shows available sections creating hierarchies. Use case: Organize qualification report logical structure (e.g., Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion).

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Specifies path Markdown file used introduction qualification report. Content: File path URL .md file edit: Enter path introduction markdown file. content appear beginning generated qualification report. Use case: Provide context, objectives, methodology overview qualification study.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Specify building block definitions included qualification report documentation. Content: - Project: Project containing building block - BB-Type: Type building block document - BB-Name: Name building block - Section Reference: Report section building block documentation appear edit: Fill rows include building block details report. useful documenting compound properties, individual parameters, formulations, etc. Data validation: Data validation dropdowns provided selecting available building blocks sections. Use case: Include detailed documentation model building blocks (compounds, individuals, etc.) qualification report.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Define global settings exported figures. Content: - Figure dimensions (width, height pixels) - Resolution (DPI) - Font sizes - visual properties edit: Modify values control appearance plots qualification report. Use case: Ensure consistent, publication-quality figures throughout report.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Define global axis settings plots. Content: - Dimension mappings (e.g., Time, Concentration) - Unit preferences - Scale types (linear, logarithmic) edit: Configure default axis properties apply plots unless overridden. Use case: Standardize axis formatting (units, scales) across plots consistency.

title: Excel Template
text: Purpose: Provides lookup tables defining allowed values various qualification plan properties. Content: Reference tables valid values used data validation Editing: EDIT sheet. defines valid options used throughout Excel file ensures data consistency.

title: Excel Template
text: Always start reviewing color-coded rows identify new (green), changed (yellow), unchanged (grey) items edit read-sheets (Projects, Simulations_Outputs, Simulations_ObsData, Lookup) can cause data inconsistencies Use data validation dropdowns wherever appear - type free text may cause validation errors Keep section references consistent - ensure section references plot sheets match defined Sections sheet Test incrementally - making significant edits, convert back JSON validate making additional changes Keep backup - save copy Excel file making major changes Document changes - use Excel comments separate notes sheet track made specific edits

title: Excel Template
text: editing Excel file, use excelToQualificationPlan() function convert back JSON qualification plan: function validate edits report errors. Common validation errors include: - Invalid section references (referencing sections don’t exist) - Invalid project simulation names (matching Projects simulation sheets Simulations_Outputs Simulations_ObsData) - Missing required columns - Invalid values matching lookup tables Always check console output error messages fix issues running qualification plan.

title: Snapshot without a Qualification Plan
text: Creating qualification plan scratch involves three main steps: Prepare project snapshot: Identify snapshot JSON file(s) want include Convert Excel: Generate Excel workbook snapshot Edit convert back: Edit Excel file add evaluations, convert JSON Let’s walk step.

title: Snapshot without a Qualification Plan
text: First, define paths input output files. snapshot can local file URL GitHub-hosted file. Note: projects, replace "Verapamil-Model.json" path project snapshot file. can : - local file path: "C:/MyProjects/MyModel.json" - GitHub URL: "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Org/Repo/main/Model.json" multiple projects, use named list:
code: # Path to the project snapshot (included with the package for this example) snapshotPaths <- "Verapamil-Model.json"  # Output file name for the qualification plan JSON qualificationPlan <- "qualification-verapamil.json"  # Output file name for the Excel workbook excelFile <- "qualification-verapamil.xlsx" snapshotPaths <- list(   "Project1" = "path/to/project1.json",   "Project2" = "path/to/project2.json" )

title: Get Started
text: typical workflow creating updating qualification plan involves following steps: Prepare Data: Define list project snapshots (JSON files) /observed datasets (CSV files) Load Create Qualification Plan: Start existing qualification plan JSON file, create new one snapshots Convert Excel: Use toExcelEditor() convert qualification plan data editable Excel workbook Edit Excel: Review modify Excel file - add evaluations, configure plots, organize sections, etc. Convert Back JSON: Use excelToQualificationPlan() convert edited Excel file back qualification plan JSON Run Qualification: Execute updated qualification plan using OSP Suite Qualification Runner approach allows leverage Excel’s familiar interface maintaining structured format required OSP Suite qualification framework.

title: Get Started
text: Steps 1 2 workflow typically involve using latest release versions project snapshots, observed data, qualification plans GitHub repositories. getLatestReleasedPaths() function automates process checking GitHub releases returning updated paths.

title: Get Started
text: following example demonstrates fetch latest released paths existing qualification plan:
code: # Get latest released paths from a qualification plan latestPaths <- getLatestReleasedPaths(   qualificationPlan = "path/to/qualification_plan.json",   includePreReleases = FALSE,   returnUpdatedOnly = TRUE )  # Access the updated project and observed data paths latestProjectPaths <- latestPaths$projects latestObservedDataPaths <- latestPaths$observedData

title: Get Started
text: can customize behavior several options: Ignore specific items: Include pre-releases: Get paths (just updates): function particularly useful maintaining qualification plans reference multiple GitHub repositories, ensures ’re always working current versions.
code: # Exclude certain projects or observed datasets from updates latestPaths <- getLatestReleasedPaths(   qualificationPlan = "path/to/qualification_plan.json",   projectsToIgnore = c("ProjectA", "ProjectB"),   observedDataToIgnore = c("ObsData1") ) # Include pre-release versions (e.g., beta, rc) latestPaths <- getLatestReleasedPaths(   qualificationPlan = "path/to/qualification_plan.json",   includePreReleases = TRUE ) # Return all paths, even if they haven't changed allPaths <- getLatestReleasedPaths(   qualificationPlan = "path/to/qualification_plan.json",   returnUpdatedOnly = FALSE )

title: Get Started

title: Get Started
text: basic example showing work project snapshots qualification plans. comprehensive, step--step tutorials covering specific scenarios, please refer following articles: Update Qualification Plan Evaluations: Learn review update existing evaluations qualification plan, including modifying plot configurations, sections, building block references. Add Snapshot Qualification Plan: Step--step guide integrating new project snapshot existing qualification plan, including handling building block inheritance simulation mappings. Create Qualification Snapshot: Complete tutorial creating new qualification plan scratch using project snapshots, ideal starting new qualification project.

title: Get Started
text: example demonstrates complete workflow updating qualification plan new project snapshots observed data:
code: ## Load the package library(ospsuite.qualificationplaneditor)  # Define GitHub base path (example uses OSP repositories) ospPath <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology" excelQualification <- "Updated-Qualification.xlsx"  # List your updated snapshot projects # These can be local file paths or GitHub URLs snapshotPaths <- list(   "Compound A" = file.path(ospPath, "A-Model/vX.X/A-Model.json"),   "Compound B" = file.path(ospPath, "B-Model/vX.X/B-Model.json"),   "A-B-DDI" = file.path(ospPath, "A-B-DDI/vX.X/A-B-DDI.json") )  # List your updated observed datasets # Each dataset requires a Path and optionally a Type observedDataPaths <- list(   "DDI Ratios" = list(     Path = file.path(ospPath, "Database-for-observed-data/vX.X/DDI.csv"),     Type = "DDIRatio"   ) )  # Path to your initial qualification plan qualificationPlan <- paste0(   ospPath,   "/A-Model/vY.Y/Qualification/qualification_plan.json" )  # Convert qualification plan to Excel for editing toExcelEditor(   fileName = excelQualification,   snapshotPaths = snapshotPaths,    observedDataPaths = observedDataPaths,   qualificationPlan = qualificationPlan )  # Open the Excel file in your default spreadsheet application utils::browseURL(excelQualification)  # After editing the Excel file, convert it back to JSON excelToQualificationPlan(   excelFile = excelQualification,   qualificationPlan = "updated-qualification_plan.json" )

title: Get Started
text: fileName: output Excel file path. Can relative absolute. snapshotPaths: named list project snapshot JSON files. Names become project IDs. observedDataPaths: named list observed data files. entry Path optionally Type fields. qualificationPlan: Path URL existing qualification plan JSON file. Omit create new plan scratch. excelTemplate: (Optional) Path custom Excel template. Uses built-template specified.

title: Get Started
text: Starting scratch: Omit qualificationPlan parameter create new qualification plan: updating evaluations: Omit snapshots just edit existing plan: Local files: Use local file paths instead URLs:
code: toExcelEditor(   fileName = "new-qualification.xlsx",   snapshotPaths = snapshotPaths ) toExcelEditor(   fileName = "updated-qualification.xlsx",   qualificationPlan = qualificationPlan ) snapshotPaths <- list(   "MyProject" = "C:/Projects/MyModel/snapshot.json" )

title: Get Started
text: Issue: “find file URL” - Verify file paths correct files exist - GitHub URLs, ensure repository, branch/tag, file path correct - Check internet connectivity remote URLs Issue: “Excel file won’t open conversion” - Ensure Excel, LibreOffice Calc, another compatible spreadsheet application installed - Try specifying full path Excel file - Check write permissions target directory Issue: “Data validation dropdowns empty” - usually means required data missing validation sheets - Ensure referenced projects simulations exist Projects, Simulations_Outputs, Simulations_ObsData sheets - Check Excel file generated successfully without errors Issue: “Conversion Excel JSON fails” - Verify haven’t modified key sheets used validation (Projects, Simulations_Outputs, Simulations_ObsData), changes can break validation - Check required columns haven’t deleted renamed - Ensure data validation rules respected (don’t type free text dropdowns required) - Look error messages R console specific validation failures Issue: “Building block inheritance working” - Verify parent project names exactly match entries Projects sheet - Check building block exists parent project - Ensure building block names types match exactly (case-sensitive)

title: Update my Qualification Plan Evaluations
text: convert without snapshots, function: Reads qualification plan: Parses JSON file Projects metadata evaluations (plots, sections, inputs) Building block parameter inheritance Plot configurations mappings Report structure (sections, introduction) Global settings MetaInfo: Schema version Projects: project definitions (read-, shown grey) Simulations_Outputs: Available outputs (read-) Simulations_ObsData: Observed data links (read-) ObsData: Observed dataset definitions (Type editable) BB: Building block inheritance (fully editable) SimParam: Parameter inheritance (fully editable) All_Plots: Individual plot evaluations (fully editable) CT_Plots/CT_Mapping: Comparison time profile plots (fully editable) GOF_Plots/GOF_Mapping: Goodness fit plots (fully editable) DDIRatio_Plots/DDIRatio_Mapping: DDI ratio plots (fully editable) PKRatio_Plots/PKRatio_Mapping: PK ratio plots (fully editable) Sections: Report section structure (fully editable) Intro: Introduction file reference (fully editable) Inputs: Building block documentation (fully editable) GlobalPlotSettings: Plot appearance settings (fully editable) GlobalAxesSettings: Axis configuration (fully editable) Lookup: Reference tables (read-) projects grey (unchanged) since new snapshots provided Data validation dropdowns enabled Read-sheets edited; modifying can cause validation conversion errors Excel file imported back tool

title: Convert Qualification Plan From/To Excel
text: can install development version ospsuite.qualificationplaneditor like :

title: Convert Qualification Plan From/To Excel
text: basic example showing include updated project snapshot qualification plan:
code: ## Load the ospsuite.qualificationplaneditor package library(ospsuite.qualificationplaneditor) ospPath <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology" excelQualification <- "Updated-Qualification.xlsx"  # List your updated snapshot projects snapshotPaths <- list(   "Compound A" = file.path(ospPath, "A-Model/vX.X/A-Model.json"),   "Compound B" = file.path(ospPath, "B-Model/vX.X/B-Model.json"),   "A-B-DDI" = file.path(ospPath, "A-B-DDI/vX.X/A-B-DDI.json") )  # List your updated observed datasets observedDataPaths <- list("DDI Ratios" = list(     Path = file.path(ospPath, "Database-for-observed-data/vX.X/DDI.csv"),     Type = "DDIRatio"     ))  # Initial qualification plan qualificationPlan <- file.path(ospPath, "A-Model/vY.Y/Qualification/qualification_plan.json")  # Qualification plan converted to Excel excelUI(   fileName = excelQualification,   snapshotPaths = snapshotPaths,    observedDataPaths = observedDataPaths,   qualificationPlan = qualificationPlan )  # Tip: this will open Excel (or Libre office) with the created Excel workbook utils::browseURL(excelQualification)
